Fix: Enhanced date field sanitization in employee PATCH endpoint

Fixed "invalid input syntax for type date" error that occurred when updating 
employee fields like filing status.

## Problem
When updating any employee field, if date fields (dob, hire_date, inactive_date) 
had null or undefined values, they could be sent as empty strings or "undefined" 
strings, causing PostgreSQL to reject the update.

## Solution
Enhanced the sanitization logic in the PATCH endpoint to:
1. Convert empty strings ("") to null
2. Convert undefined values to null
3. Convert "undefined" strings to null
4. Remove any undefined keys from the update object entirely

## Changes
- apps/web/src/app/api/employees/route.ts
  - Improved date field sanitization (lines 74-84)
  - Added cleanup of undefined values (lines 86-91)
  - Added console.error logging for debugging

This ensures that no matter what values are sent from the frontend,
the database always receives valid date values (proper date string or null).
